item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Apple Computer Inc.
item.description: "Here's to the crazy ones. The misfits. The rebels. The troublemakers. The round pegs in the square holes. The ones who see things differently. They're not fond of rules. And they have no respect for the status quo. You can quote them, disagree with them, glorify or vilify them. About the only thing you can't do is ignore them. Because they change things. They push the human race forward. And while some may see them as the crazy ones, we see genius. Because the people who are crazy enough to think they can change the world, are the ones who do." -- Apple Computer Inc.

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Bessie Anderson Stanley
Elizabeth add a quote by E.E. Cummings
item.description: "It takes courage to grow up and become who you really are." -- E.E. Cummings

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "In the depth of winter, I finally learned that within me there lay an invincible summer." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "Be patient toward all that is unsolved in your heart and try to love the questions themselves, like locked rooms and like books that are now written in a very foreign tongue. Do not now seek the answers, which cannot be given you because you would not be able to live them. And the point is, to live everything. Live the questions now. Perhaps you will then gradually, without noticing it, live along some distant day into the answer." -- Rainer Maria Rilke

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Arundhati Roy
item.description: "To love. To be loved. To never forget your own insignificance. To never get used to the unspeakable violence and the vulgar disparity of life around you. To seek joy in the saddest places. To pursue beauty to its lair. To never simplify what is complicated or complicate what is simple. To respect strength, never power. Above all, to watch. To try and understand. To never look away. And never, never to forget." -- Arundhati Roy

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Anais Nin
item.description: "And the day came when the risk to remain tight in a bud was more painful than the risk it took to blossom." -- Anais Nin

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Live to the point of tears." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Malcolm X
item.description: "You're not to be so blind with patriotism that you can't face reality. Wrong is wrong, no matter who does it or says it." -- Malcolm X

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Barack Obama
item.description: "We are the change we have been waiting for." -- Barack Obama

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Pablo Picasso
item.description: "Everything you can imagine is real." -- Pablo Picasso

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Buddha Siddhartha Guatama Shakyamuni
item.description: "The secret of health for both mind and body is not to mourn for the past, nor to worry about the future, but to live the present moment wisely and earnestly." -- Buddha Siddhartha Guatama Shakyamuni

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Gabriel García Márquez
item.description: "No medicine cures what happiness cannot." -- Gabriel García Márquez

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Anton Chekhov
item.description: "Medicine is my lawful wife and literature my mistress; when I get tired of one, I spend the night with the other." -- Anton Chekhov
